abstract: Those who favor the European Union are frustrated by the silence of business on the E.U.'s commercial benefits, when, in private, company bosses are outspoken about the risks of withdrawal.
snippet: Those who favor the European Union are frustrated by the silence of business on the E.U.'s commercial benefits, when, in private, company bosses are outspoken about the risks of withdrawal.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — The chairman of the London Stock Exchange, Chris Gibson-Smith, simply does not have the time to speak. Christopher North, the boss of Amazon in Britain, is too busy as well. And Charles Dunstone, the founder of the mobile phone retailer Carphone Warehouse, also has an exceptionally full agenda.

headline.main: British Business Leaders Stay Silent on E.U. Exit
headline.print_headline: British Chiefs Stay Silent On E.U. Exit
